author: Raymundo Rangel Laguna
title: Sheinbaum recibe otro galardÃ³n: le otorgan el Premio Internacional Bonifacio VIII | Radio FÃ³rmula
text: [La presidenta electa de MÃ©xico, Claudia Sheinbaum,](https://www.radioformula.com.mx/nacional/2024/9/19/sheinbaumania-641-de-la-ciudadania-esta-emocionada-considera-que-sera-buen-gobierno-833577.html) expresÃ³ su gratitud este jueves a la Academia Bonifaciana por recibir el Premio Internacional Bonifacio VIII en la categorÃ­a de Cultura de la Paz. A travÃ©s de su cuenta en X (anteriormente Twitter), la presidenta electa de MÃ©xico comentÃ³: "Agradezco a la Academia Bonifaciana y a su rector, Sante De Angelis, por concederme el â€˜Premio Internacional Bonifacio VIII por la Cultura de la Pazâ€™ en su ediciÃ³n XXII, en reconocimiento a mi trayectoria acadÃ©mica y polÃ­tica", escribiÃ³. Â¿QuÃ© es el Premio Internacional Bonifacio VIII? El Premio Internacional Bonifacio VIII es un prestigioso galardÃ³n otorgado por la Academia Bonifaciana en Anagni, Italia. Este premio honra a individuos, instituciones y organizaciones que han hecho contribuciones significativas al diÃ¡logo entre culturas, la paz, y la promociÃ³n de valores humanitarios. Te podrÃ­a interesar Nombrado en honor del Papa Bonifacio VIII, el premio reconoce los esfuerzos de quienes fomentan la cooperaciÃ³n internacional, la fraternidad y los valores Ã©ticos en campos como la polÃ­tica, la ciencia, el arte y la religiÃ³n. Â¿QuiÃ©n fue Bonifacio VIII? Conocido originalmente como Benedetto Gaetani, Bonifacio VIII fue un pontÃ­fice de la Edad Media destacado por su influencia en la polÃ­tica y la cultura de su Ã©poca. Nacido en el sur de Italia, estudiÃ³ derecho canÃ³nico en Todi, Bolonia y ParÃ­s. Durante su papado, su principal objetivo fue la cruzada y la restauraciÃ³n de la paz entre los reinos cristianos. Homenaje a las vÃ­ctimas de los sismos En otra publicaciÃ³n en su cuenta de Twitter, Claudia Sheinbaum tambiÃ©n rindiÃ³ homenaje a las vÃ­ctimas de los sismos de 1985 y 2017. Durante el acto en el ZÃ³calo de la Ciudad de MÃ©xico, estuvo acompaÃ±ada por el presidente LÃ³pez Obrador, con quien realizÃ³ el izamiento a media asta de la bandera mexicana. [Claudia Sheinbaum](https://www.radioformula.com.mx/nacional/2024/9/19/alzan-la-voz-en-sinaloa-empresas-ongs-ciudadanos-piden-al-gobierno-alto-la-violencia-833603.html) concluyÃ³: â€œen memoria de las vÃ­ctimas de los sismos de 1985 y 2017, acompaÃ±amos al presidente @lopezobrador_ al izamiento de bandera".

author: Joseph S. Pete joseph.pete@nwi.com, 219-933-3316
title: Purdue Extension to present Alzheimer's Awareness Program
text:
The Purdue University Extension will host Alzheimerâ€™s awareness programs at libraries across Lake County this summer.
â€œLake County has the highest incidence of Alzheimerâ€™s disease and dementia out of all counties in Indiana,â€ the Purdue University Extension said in a news release. â€œThere is a growing need for early detection, support and assistance for residents living in our area.â€
More than 6 million people suffered from the degenerative disease, and that number is expected to grow by 12.7 million by 2050 if thereâ€™s no major medical breakthrough, according to the Alzheimerâ€™s Association.
Purdue University Extension Educator, Health and Human Sciences Linda Curley and the Alzheimerâ€™s Association will host a series of four Alzheimerâ€™s Awareness Programs at the Crown Point, Dyer-Schererville, Griffith-Calumet Township, Hammond, Hobart, Lowell, Merrillville, Munster and Whiting libraries.
People are also readingâ€¦
This spring and summer, Curley will host sessions on â€œ10 Warning Signs of Alzheimerâ€™s,â€ â€œHealthy Living for the Brain and Body,â€ â€œUnderstanding Alzheimerâ€™s and Dementiaâ€ and â€œLegal and Financial Planning for Alzheimerâ€™s Disease.â€
Each talk will run about an hour to an hour and a half.
Anyone interested can register for the program by reaching to their local library branch.
For more information, email or call Purdue Extension-Lake County at 219-755-3240.
A look back at Northwest Indiana businesses that closed in 2023
A look back at Region businesses that closed in 2023
Beer Geeks, one of the Region's first, most beloved and most influential craft beer bars, closed after more than a decade and is being reimagined as a new concept.
[
88-year-old White Castle in Whiting, one of Chicago area's first, coming down to be replaced with new restaurant](/news/local/88-year-old-white-castle-in-whiting-one-of-chicago-areas-first-coming-down-to/article_63869ea6-1aa6-542b-92c9-bd5d795d4244.html)
The landmark 88-year-old castle-shaped White Castle in Whiting is coming down to be replaced with a newer, larger, more modern White Castle restaurant.
A longtime staple in downtown Crown Point poured its last drink.
The longtime Westforth Sports gun shop is closing.
The Silver Line Building Products plant at 16801 Exchange Ave. will be shuttered permanently.
Brewfest in Highland will close in what's been called "an end of an era."
David's Bridal filed for bankruptcy and could close all stores if no buyer emerges to save it.
The 88-year-old Whiting White Castle will be remembered with displays at museums in two different states.
For years, the "millionaire's club" met every morning in the corner booth of the historic 88-year-old White Castle at Indianapolis Boulevard and 119th Street in downtown Whiting. The landmark restaurant served its final slider Tuesday.
[
Downtown Griffith staple G&G Hobbies left to longtime employee, who's looking for buyer to keep it going](/news/local/downtown-griffith-staple-g-g-hobbies-left-to-longtime-employee-whos-looking-for-buyer-to/article_2e08c647-4ae4-53b6-96e4-57c3dc868718.html)
One of Northwest Indiana's most popular and enduring hobby shops is looking for a buyer after the longtime owner died.
J&L This N That Consignment Shop, a popular thrift store, closed in downtown Whiting after a run of several years.
A Calumet Region institution, Calumet Fisheries on the far South Side of Chicago, is temporarily closed after failing a city health inspection.
Just days after reopening after city health inspectors shut it down, Calumet Fisheries suffered a major fire.
Pepe's Mexican Restaurant is no mas in Valparaiso.
Beer Geeks in Highland rebranded as B-Side Bar & Lounge and then closed within a few months.
[
Bed Bath and Beyond to close Valparaiso store and multiple Chicagoland locations, leaving just one Region location left](/news/local/business/bed-bath-and-beyond-to-close-valparaiso-store-and-multiple-chicagoland-locations-leaving-just-one/article_cbe8edf7-f634-5789-b637-9f9981362abd.html)
Troubled retailer Bed Bath and Beyond will permanently close its Valparaiso location as it shutters more stores nationwide as it looks to restructure and shrink its footprint to save the struggling business.
Peoples Bank has shuttered its branch in downtown Hammond.
Viking Artisan Ales will soon pour its last craft beer at its Merrillville taproom.
Old Chicago Pizza & Taproom is closing after 15 years at one of Northwest Indiana's most prominent highway interchanges.
The Chicago Auto Show, the nation's largest auto show, returns to McCormick Place Saturday, running through Feb. 19.

author: world today news
title: Five places to celebrate a white Christmas in the United States
text:
One of the most fascinating aspects of USA It is its seasonal climate, which transforms much of the country into winter. During the end of the year, many regions are covered with a blanket of white snow, creating landscapes that are irresistible and charming for tourists.
There is nothing more charming than a white Christmas, which invites you to enjoy hot drinks by the fireplace, while wearing themed sweaters that evoke Santa Claus, gifts and the warmth of sharing with family, all in an atmosphere full of magic and tradition. These are five recommendations to live the full Christmas in the United States.
Chicago Christmas Festival
This city is dressed in more than a million twinkling white Christmas lights that decorate the 200 trees that stretch across the famous Magnificent Mile Chicagoâ€™s most exclusive shopping avenue. Neighboring Navy Pier is also going all-in with the Winter WonderFest festival, featuring more than 24 attractions and a massive indoor skating rink. One of the best activities can be a visit to the Christkindlmarket Christmas market, located in the city center, where you can buy crafts and delicious seasonal food.
Winter Sports in Aspen
Christmas in Aspen It is a magical experience that combines the charm of a snow-covered alpine landscape with the luxury and warmth of a small mountain town. Lights shine from every corner, from the snow-covered trees to the elegant boutiques and cozy chalets, creating a fairytale atmosphere. The crisp air of the Rocky Mountains invites you to enjoy winter sports like skiing and snowboarding, while the streets come alive with Christmas markets, concerts and events celebrating the season. Aspen offers an unforgettable Christmas, where nature and the holiday spirit merge perfectly.
A little history in Boston
Christmas in Boston It has a special charm, where history and festivities are intertwined in every corner of the city. The cobblestone streets and colonial buildings are illuminated with festive decorations, creating a cozy and nostalgic atmosphere. The famous Faneuil Hall is transformed with a light show synchronized to Christmas music, while the trees on Boston Common shine as symbols of the season. In addition, ice skating on the Frog Pond, surrounded by a snowy environment, and enjoying the choirs that fill the squares with traditional Christmas carols make Christmas in Boston a warm, vibrant celebration full of history.
Storybook Christmas in Connecticut
Christmas in Connecticut It is pure magic, with landscapes that seem straight out of a winter story. Small towns and villages are dressed in bright lights, with picturesquely decorated houses and avenues adorned with garlands. In Mystic and Essex, rides on vintage trains and illuminated river boats evoke a nostalgic feeling of times gone by. Plus, hand-cut Christmas trees from local farms, Christmas markets filled with traditional crafts and sweets, and snow covering the countryside create an atmosphere of warmth and joy that makes Christmas in Connecticut an unforgettable experience. , perfect to enjoy with the family.
A Christmas trolley runs through Orlando
This destination is a must-see during the New Yearâ€™s Eve season, even if not a single flake of snow falls. The â€œcity of parksâ€ transforms, filling every corner with Christmas charm and themed decorations that capture the spirit of the season. The iconic trolley, adorned with lights and ornaments, turns each journey into a more colorful and welcoming experience. Furthermore, December is an excellent opportunity to visit this Florida city, taking advantage of the great discounts at its outlets, which makes the trip even more attractive.
Any destination you choose will be a success to experience a beautiful Christmas in the United States.
*Content in collaboration with VisitTheUSA

author: Adolfo Soares
title: Analistas preveem que a Switch 2 venda 15 milhÃµes de unidades em 2025
text:
Analistas preveem que a Switch 2 venda 15 milhÃµes de unidades em 2025
A Nintendo anunciou que a sua nova consola, a Nintendo Switch 2, serÃ¡ lanÃ§ada mundialmente a 5 de junho de 2025. A consola estarÃ¡ disponÃ­vel em duas versÃµes: a bÃ¡sica por â‚¬469,99 e um pacote que inclui o jogo Mario Kart World por â‚¬509,99. As prÃ©-reservas comeÃ§am a 8 de abril.
A Switch 2 apresenta vÃ¡rias melhorias em relaÃ§Ã£o ao modelo anterior, incluindo um ecrÃ£ Full HD de 7,9 polegadas com uma taxa de atualizaÃ§Ã£o de 120 Hz, suporte para resoluÃ§Ã£o 4K quando ligada Ã  base e 256 GB de armazenamento interno. Os novos comandos Joy-Con 2 tÃªm funcionalidades melhoradas, tais como uma ligaÃ§Ã£o magnÃ©tica e botÃµes adicionais para GameChat e separaÃ§Ã£o rÃ¡pida.
Mario Kart World Ã© o tÃ­tulo de destaque no lanÃ§amento, ao trazer uma experiÃªncia de corrida em mundo aberto com suporte para atÃ© 24 jogadores em simultÃ¢neo. O jogo introduz alteraÃ§Ãµes climÃ¡ticas e segmentos todo-o-terreno.
Os analistas da Omdia preveem que a Nintendo Switch 2 possa vender aproximadamente 14,7 milhÃµes de unidades a nÃ­vel mundial atÃ© ao final de 2025, ultrapassando as vendas do modelo original em cerca de 10% no mesmo perÃ­odo apÃ³s o lanÃ§amento. Esta projeÃ§Ã£o Ã© impulsionada por uma base sÃ³lida de utilizadores ativos e pelo apelo de tÃ­tulos exclusivos como Mario Kart World.
â€œO software original Ã© o principal impulsionador de conteÃºdos para a adoÃ§Ã£o do hardware da Switch, um forte contraste com a PlayStation e a Xboxâ€, afirmou James McWhirter, Analista SÃ©nior da equipa de Jogos da Omdia. â€œA Nintendo terÃ¡ de trabalhar arduamente para comunicar um claro salto geracional com a Switch 2 ao longo do seu ciclo de vida, uma vez que os seus novos jogos existirÃ£o juntamente com a extensa biblioteca de tÃ­tulos anteriores que nÃ£o requerem uma atualizaÃ§Ã£o da consola para que os utilizadores possam desfrutar.â€

author: Ophelie Depew
title: Giga ML Aims to Revolutionize LLM Deployment for Enterprises | Robots.net
text: AI technology has been gaining significant traction in recent years, particularly in the form of large language models (LLMs) such as ChatGPT. According to a recent survey of approximately 1,000 enterprise organizations, around 67.2% have identified the adoption of LLMs as a top priority by early 2024. Key Takeaway Giga ML is addressing the challenges of data privacy and customization faced by enterprises in adopting LLMs. Challenges in LLM Deployment Despite the growing interest in LLM adoption, businesses are facing barriers related to customization, flexibility, and the preservation of company knowledge and intellectual property. These challenges have hindered the smooth deployment of LLMs into production environments. Introducing Giga ML In response to these challenges, Varun Vummadi and Esha Manideep Dinne founded Giga ML, a startup focused on developing a platform that enables companies to deploy LLMs on-premise. This approach aims to reduce costs and uphold privacy standards during the deployment process. Giga MLâ€™s Offerings Giga ML provides its own series of LLMs, known as the â€œX1 series,â€ designed for tasks such as code generation and addressing common customer queries. The startup claims that these models, built on Metaâ€™s Llama 2, outperform popular LLMs on specific benchmarks, particularly the MT-Bench test set for dialogs. Privacy and Customization Giga MLâ€™s mission is to facilitate the safe and efficient deployment of LLMs on enterprisesâ€™ on-premises infrastructure or virtual private clouds. By offering an easy-to-use API, Giga ML simplifies the process of training, fine-tuning, and running LLMs, thereby eliminating associated hassles. Furthermore, Giga ML emphasizes the privacy advantages of running models offline, which is likely to be a compelling factor for many businesses. Predibase, a low-code AI development platform, found that a significant portion of enterprises are hesitant to use commercial LLMs due to concerns about sharing sensitive or proprietary data with vendors. Future Plans Giga ML, backed by approximately $3.74 million in VC funding from investors such as Nexus Venture Partners, Y Combinator, and Liquid 2 Ventures, intends to expand its team and bolster product research and development. The company also aims to support its customer base, which currently includes undisclosed enterprise companies in the finance and healthcare sectors.

author: @WMCActionNews5
title: Women use Double Dutch Therapy to push toward a Healthier 901
text: MEMPHIS, Tenn. (WMC) - The push continues for the Mid-South to lose one million pounds in three years. So far, Mid-Southerners have lost more than 8,300 pounds as part of Methodist Le Bonheur Healthcareâ€™s Healthier 901 Challenge . One group of women is jumping into the initiative with double dutch . With each hop, skip and jump, the ladies of Double Dutch Therapy are empowering other women to get healthy and have fun doing it! â€œDouble Dutch Therapy is just not about double dutch. Itâ€˜s about a sisterhood, itâ€˜s about wellness, itâ€™s about fitness, itâ€™s about coming together and saying, â€™you as my sister, I care,â€™â€ said Double Dutch Therapy Founder Selena Cook. The group started in May but already has chapters in Delaware, California, Illinois, Memphis and Batesville. Cook says no matter your level of skillâ€¦thereâ€™s room for everyone to â€œjumpâ€ in on the fun. â€œThe criteria to join Double Dutch Therapy is you have to be a woman over 39 and thatâ€™s it,â€ Cook said. Each lady donned their age on the back of their shirts. The groupâ€™s oldest member lives in California and is 92 (and a half) years old! Cook says when she learned about the Healthier 901 Challenge, she knew she wanted Double Dutch Therapy to be involved. The group went to this yearâ€™s Healthier 901 Fest, showing off their skills and recruiting new members. â€œWe received over 66 emails from Healthier 901 saying â€˜how can I join the challenge thatâ€™s encouraging people to lose collectively a million poundsâ€™...who wouldnâ€™t want to be a part of that?â€ Cook said. If jumping isnâ€™t your thing, the group also line dances, hula hoops and does hopscotch. Michelle Vinne, Co-leader for the Memphis Chapter of Double Dutch Therapy, says it makes her feel like a kid again. â€œIt reminds me of my childhood. Just good memories. The things we used to do. We were so free back then, and things are so restricted now. The kids donâ€™t even come outside for the most part now. So itâ€™s just a joy to do something now that we used to have the pleasure of doing as children,â€ Vinne said. To join the Double Dutch Therapy group or the Healthier 901 Challenge, click here . Click here to sign up for our newsletter! https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfpc96d0EDHinF_AovDBi4RNoKbBfRbCIJiTWqF7p1VNE6ZNA/viewform to report a spelling or grammar error. Please include the headline. Copyright 2024 WMC. All rights reserved.

author: Guest Columnist - Unlimited Digital Access
title: Sandra Day O'Connor: Late justice was a beacon for justice and hope
text: When I met Sandra Day O'Connor, she proved to be a beacon for justice, leadership and hope I grieve Justice Sandra Day O'Connor's passing and I pray that her ideals will be remembered and celebrated by many future generations to come. - Dr. Michael C. Caldwell served as the Dutchess County, New York Commissioner of Health from 1994-2013 and the Nashville Public Health Director in 2020. - He now serves as associate vice-president for vaccine research & education at Meharry Medical College and will soon be joining the newly announced Meharry School of Global Health. It was Veteransâ€™ Day 2007. I arrived at the [FDR Home & Library](https://www.nps.gov/hofr/index.htm) in Hyde Park, New York with the anticipation of a young boy about to meet one of his heroes. [Sandra Day Oâ€™Connor](/story/news/politics/2023/12/19/sandra-day-oconnor-funeral-washington-honors-memories/71969128007/) grew up on a cattle ranch in Arizona. She graduated third in her class from Stanford Law School in 1952, a time when women were a rarity in the legal profession. Despite her academic achievements, she faced gender discrimination when seeking employment. However, Oâ€™Connorâ€™s determination led her to a successful career in law and politics, culminating in her appointment to the Supreme Court by President Ronald Reagan in 1981. During her tenure on the Supreme Court, Justice Oâ€™Connor was known for her pragmatic approach to law and her ability to build consensus among her colleagues. She often served as the swing vote in many critical cases, shaping the legal landscape on issues such as abortion rights, affirmative action, and the separation of church and state. Her decisions were marked by a careful balance between individual rights and governmental powers. [Oâ€™Connorâ€™s speech at the FDR Library](https://www.fdrlibrary.org/documents/356632/390886/sc_keynote.pdf/cdaf4825-c4b7-4979-aff4-2cbfc8544089) that November day, was a fitting venue given her admiration for Rooseveltâ€™s commitment to democracy and justice. Her insights have more relevance for us now than ever. Her speech focused on the importance of judicial independence and the threats it faces in contemporary society. She warned against the increasing politicization of the judiciary and the dangers it poses to the rule of law. Civic education preserves judicial independence, Oâ€™Connor said [Oâ€™Connor argued that the judiciary](https://youtu.be/ekhJbsEuMFg) must remain independent to protect individual rights and uphold the Constitution. She expressed concern about the growing trend of judges being evaluated based upon their perceived political leanings rather than their legal expertise and integrity. She emphasized that judges should not be seen as politicians in robes but as impartial arbiters of justice. Furthermore, Oâ€™Connor highlighted the importance of civic education in preserving judicial independence. She believed that a well-informed public is crucial in maintaining a robust and independent judiciary. Her words reflected her dedication to educating the public about the judiciaryâ€™s role in safeguarding democracy. Sandra Day Oâ€™Connorâ€™s life and career were marked by a steadfast commitment to justice and equality. As the first woman to serve on the Supreme Court, she has left an indelible mark on American jurisprudence, and her words continue to inspire and guide those who believe in the rule of law. May Justice Oâ€™Connorâ€™s legacy be honored by generations to come Meeting her on that November day in 2007, with the spirit of Franklin and Eleanor Roosevelt around us was magical. She greeted me with a warm smile and spoke to me in her charming Arizonan/Texas accent. She was curious to know more about Lyme disease and the other challenges that I faced serving as the local Commissioner of Health in the Hudson Valley. Those that knew her well would agree that her conversation with me was just one of her hallmark traits of empathy, caring, listening and taking an interest in others. I celebrate the life of Sandra Day Oâ€™Connor and that special day that I was privileged to meet her. I grieve her passing and I pray that her ideals will be remembered and celebrated by many future generations to come. Dr. Michael C. Caldwell served as the Dutchess County, New York Commissioner of Health from 1994-2013 and the Nashville Public Health Director in 2020 where he led the Department for the first year of the COVID pandemic. He now serves as associate vice-president for vaccine research & education at Meharry Medical College and will soon be joining the newly announced [Meharry School of Global Health](/story/news/health/2023/12/28/meharry-launching-school-of-global-health-to-address-health-equity/72032422007/).

author: Canadian Press
title: Union representing 40 per cent of Quebec teachers reaches deal, ends unlimited strike
text:
MONTREAL â€” A union representing 40 per cent of Quebec teachers has reached a deal in principle with the government and is ending a strike that has shut around 800 schools since Nov. 23.
FÃ©dÃ©ration autonome de lâ€™enseignement â€” or FAE â€” said Thursday night on social media that it spent the day analyzing a tentative deal with the province and will recommend it to its members for approval during general assemblies after the holidays. Details of the agreement have not been released.
Even though the FAE called the deal "a new step," it emphasized "it is up to the teachers to respond to (Premier) FranÃ§ois Legault's government and to say whether they feel they have been heard."
The union said it has ended all of its pressure tactics, such as the general strike that has shut 800 schools, including in Montreal, since the end of November. If students affected by the FAE strike return to school as scheduled in January, they will have been away from classes for almost seven consecutive weeks.
The FAE, which represents more than 66,000 teachers, took the most hard line out of all the public sector unions negotiating new contracts with the government when it launched an unlimited general strike.
Earlier today, the government announced it had reached tentative deals on salaries with an alliance of unions, excluding the FAE, representing 420,000 public sector employees, including teachers and health-care workers. They had walked out sporadically since November, for a total of 11 days.
The only major labour group without any sort of agreement is a nurses union with about 80,000 members â€” FÃ©dÃ©ration interprofessionnelle de la santÃ© du QuÃ©bec â€” which said today that negotiations are ongoing.
Earlier Thursday, before the FAE announced the end to its strike, Sylvain Martel, spokesman for parents group Regroupement des comitÃ©s de parents autonomes du QuÃ©bec, said he was feeling optimistic but remaining cautious that 800 schools would reopen after the holiday break.
"We're glad that we're able to hope for going back to school on Jan. 9, but everything is tentative, lots of people have to agree to what's on the table, so let's hope that it's a real deal and (union) members will get what they want," he said in an interview.
Martel said discussions have been taking place between teachers, parents and administrators about how children will catch up after missing so much school. How that happens will vary, he said, because the effects of the strikes were unequal â€” some parents taught their children at home, others hired tutors, but many less-fortunate students spent weeks with little to no learning at all.
"It's very difficult for students to go back to the same rhythm they were in November, so it's going to take a little while, but we'll get there," he said.
This report by The Canadian Press was first published Dec. 28, 2023.
The Canadian Press
